page.title: 16WELSH SPOKEN LANGUAGE
page.content: This is a bilingual area. Welsh remains the natural language & it is the settlers from England that have contributed mainly to the anglicisa- tion of the area. The spoken Welsh is rich in dialect & vocabulary. It shows the dual influence of old counties of Montgomery & Meirioneth & is a valuable oral contribution to the Welsh language. The typical Montgomery accent is heard in the words da, na, tad, bach. But these words are not over pronounced with the typical open e. The local accent definitely caters for a choice between e and a. The sound produced is bore, tamed, cefen, enwe, llyfre, Dolgelle. A good number of words show clearly the influence of Montgomey & Merioneth on the area. Eg. cog/bachgen/hogyn, cyfer/acer, blawd/ fflwr, gwrych/shetin, anglodd/ cloddegoeth/cynhebrwng.
